sen.j: 真人（しんじん）は、老荘思想・道教において人間の理想像とされる存在。
sen.e: Shinjin is the ideal of human in the thought of Laozi and Zhuangzi and Taoism.

sen.cmt: 他の記事（臣）と統一し、こちらも漢字を追記しました。
sen.e: Shinjin (真人) is the ideal of human in the thought of Laozi and Zhuangzi and Taoism.

sen.j: 仙人の別称として用いられることもある。
sen.e: It is sometimes used as another name of sennin (hermit).

sen.j: 真人（まひと）は、八色の姓で制定されたカバネ（かばね）の一つ。
sen.e: Mahito is one of the Kabane (hereditary titles) enacted by Yakusa no Kabane (the eight honorary titles).

sen.e: Mahito (真人) is one of the kabane (hereditary titles) enacted by Yakusa no Kabane (the eight honorary titles).

sen.j: 真人（まひと）は、684年（天武13）に制定された八色の姓（やくさのかばね）の一つで、最高位の姓（かばね）である。
sen.e: Mahito was one of the Yakusa no Kabane established in 684 and was top grade Kabane.
Mahito was one of the Yakusa no Kabane established in 684 and was top grade kabane.
sen.cmt: kabane 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Mahito was one of the Yakusa no Kabane established in 684 and was top grade kabane.

sen.j: 「真人」は、貴人（うまひと）の意味とも新羅の骨品制の直訳ともいう。
sen.e: It is said that Mahito meant the nobilities or literal translation of caste system of Silla.
It is said that 'Mahito' meant the nobilities or that it is the literal translation of the caste system of Silla.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を補足しました。
sen.e: It is said that 'Mahito' meant the nobilities or that it is the literal translation of the caste system of Silla.

sen.j: 基本的に、継体天皇の近親とそれ以降の天皇・皇子の子孫に与えられた。
sen.e: Basically, it is given to close blood relatives of Emperor Keitai and next Emperor, Prince descendants.
Basically, it is given to close blood relatives of Emperor Keitai and the descendants of the subsequent emperors and princes.
sen.cmt: それ以降の～ の翻訳を補足しました。
sen.e: Basically, it is given to close blood relatives of Emperor Keitai and the descendants of the subsequent emperors and princes.

sen.j: 天皇の称号が道教の天皇大帝に由来するという説とともに、この「真人」も道教由来のものとする説がある。
sen.e: There are two theories that Emperor title derived from Tien-Huang-ta-ti and also 'Mahito' came from Taoism.
There is a theory that the title of tenno (天皇) (emperor) derived from Tien-Huang-ta-ti (天皇大帝) of Taoism, and also some say that this 'Mahito' also came from Taoism.
sen.cmt: 天皇の称号がどのように関連しているのか分かりやすいように漢字を追記しました。
sen.e: There is a theory that the title of tenno (天皇) (emperor) derived from Tien-Huang-ta-ti (天皇大帝) of Taoism, and also some say that this 'Mahito' also came from Taoism.

sen.j: 八色の姓のなかでは道師も道教の神学用語と重なっている。
sen.e: In Yakusa no Kabane, master is the same meaning as a term of Taoism.
In Yakusa no Kabane, michinoshi is also derived from a term of Taoism.
sen.cmt: 導師→michinoshi に修正しました。
sen.e: In Yakusa no Kabane, michinoshi is also derived from a term of Taoism.

sen.j: また天武天皇の諡（おくりな）の「瀛真人」（おきのまひと）は道教の神学では「瀛州」（えいしゅう）という海中の神山に住む仙人の高級者を意味する。
sen.e: Also Emperor Tenmu's okurina (a posthumous name) 'Oki no Mahito' means high rank hermit who lived in the holy mountain in the sea called 'Eishu' according to Taoism.

sen.j: 真人賜姓は天武天皇が構想する皇親政治の一翼を担うものであった。
sen.e: Mahito shisei (bestowing a surname) was a part of the pro-imperial family politics which was the concept of Emperor Tenmu.
Bestowing the kabane of Mahito was a part of the pro-Imperial Family politics which was the concept of Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: 真人賜姓→bestowing the kabane of Mahito としました。
sen.e: Bestowing the kabane of Mahito was a part of the pro-Imperial Family politics which was the concept of Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』の天武天皇十三年十月の条に、「守山公・路公（みちのきみ）・高橋公・三国氏・当麻氏・茨城公（うまらきのきみ）・多治比氏（たぢひのきみ）・猪名公（ゐなのきみ）・坂田公・羽田公・息長氏（おきながのきみ） ・酒人公（さかひとのきみ）・山道公、十三氏に、姓を賜ひて真人と曰ふ」とあって、これら公（きみ）姓氏族はおよそ応神天皇 ・継体～用明天皇の皇子の子孫である。
sen.e: According to an article appeared in October 684 in the "Nihon shoki" (Chronicles of Japan), "Following thirteen clans should be given kabane, Mahito; Moriyama no Kimi, Michi no Kimi, Takahashi no Kimi, the Mikuni clan, the Taima clan, Umara no Kimi, Tjihi no Kimi, Ina no Kimi, Sakata no Kimi, Hata no Kimi, Okinaga no Kimi, Sakahito no Kimi, Yamaji no Kimi" and these Kimi kabane clans are probably the descendants of from Emperor Ojin, Emperor Keitai to Emperor Yomei.

According to an article appeared in November 684 in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), 'Following 13 clans should be given the kabane of Mahito; Moriyama no Kimi, Michi no Kimi, Takahashi no Kimi, the Mikuni clan, Taima clan, Umara no Kimi, Tajihi no Kimi, Ina no Kimi, Sakata no Kimi, Hata no Kimi, Okinaga no Kimi, Sakahito no Kimi, Yamaji no Kimi' and these Kimi kabane clans are probably the descendants of Emperor Ojin and those from Emperor Keitai to Emperor Yomei.

sen.j: それ以降の天皇・皇子の子孫についても、奈良時代にたびたび賜姓が行われ、『新撰姓氏録』の載せる真人姓は48氏に昇る（六国史にのみ所見のものも含むと更に増加）。
sen.e: After the Emperor Yomei era, descenendants of emperors and princes were often given a surname in the Nara period and Mahito kababe recorded more than 48 clans in the "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility) (If it include only appeared in "Rikkokushi" [the Six National Histories], Mahito kabane clan increased more).

sen.j: しかし、時あたかも藤原氏による権勢拡大の最中で、真人＝高貴という原義すら崩れ始めていたことも否めず、氷上塩焼 ・不破内親王のように一種の懲罰として賜姓される例も現れた。
sen.e: But it was the in the middle of expansion of power by Fujiwara clan, also the definition that Mahito equal noble was beginning to collapse so it was treated an example of punishment such as Shioyaki HIKAMI, Imperial Princess Fuwa.

sen.e: This trend increased in the Heian period and when YOSHIMINE no Yauyo (the prince of Emperor Kanmu) was given the name YOSHIMINE no Ason Kabane, people of the imperial family and Mahito kabane wanted to given Ason increased.
